meanings.definition: A type of monkey native to South America.
meanings.sent1: The sakis swung gracefully from tree to tree in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of sakis playing in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The sakis wore tiny hats and danced around, entertaining the tourists.
meanings.sent4: The sakis' tails were like long, elegant ribbons flowing behind them.
meanings.sent5: The colorful fur of the sakis made them stand out among the green leaves.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'saki', referring to more than one of these monkeys.
meanings.sent1: Many sakis gathered near the riverbank, chattering loudly.
meanings.sent2: The zoo had a special exhibit featuring different species of sakis.
meanings.sent3: The sakis decided to have a party to celebrate their new treehouse.
meanings.sent4: The forest echoed with the calls of the sakis, creating a symphony of sounds.
meanings.sent5: A family of sakis enjoyed a peaceful afternoon under the shade of a large tree.
